elements.title: Chris Kreider (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Chris Kreider (pictured) scored his first five NHL goals before ever playing a regular season game?

elements.title: Der Bialistoker Shtern (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1939–1941 newspaper Der Bialistoker Shtern had a unique spelling policy that combined standard Soviet Yiddish orthography with the use of traditional final forms of Hebrew letters?

elements.title: Geoff Bent (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Geoff Bent, one of Manchester United's Busby Babes, saved a child from drowning in a canal?

elements.title: On Patrol: Live (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that A&E Networks filed a lawsuit against the producers of On Patrol: Live, alleging that it was a "blatant rip-off" of their show Live PD?

elements.title: Zakir Husain (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Zakir Husain was the first Muslim and the first governor of a state to be elected President of India?

elements.title: Bellona's Husband: A Romance (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1887 novel Bellona's Husband: A Romance by William James Roe "may be the earliest example of the time in reverse tale presented in full-fledged narrative form"?

elements.title: Republican Palace Museum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Republican Palace Museum in Khartoum was originally a cathedral?

elements.title: Matt Landers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after playing football for three different high schools, Matt Landers played for three different colleges?
